p: Separate analyses for May 2016 ( N = 10 sites, two sites excluded from analysis due to fence damage) showed similar cover at low and high earthworm density sites and between open and fenced plots ( P > 0.05), but a significant effect of site invasion ( F 1,14=5.33, P = 0.04). Total cover was significantly higher at the five sites dominated by non-native vegetation (42 ± 17.1 %; mean ± 1SE; N = 5 sites; values reflect mean of median cover per plot) than at the five sites dominated by native vegetation (23 ± 3.9 %). We found no significant effect of fencing or earthworm density on vegetation height ( P > 0.5).
